title: Hezbollah launches 30 rockets into Israel , no casualties reported
message:
Hezbollah launched 30 rockets from Lebanon into northern Israel early Monday, though no casualties were reported, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed.
"Following sirens that sounded a short while ago in northern Israel, approximately 30 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area of Kabri, a number of which fell in open areas," an IDF spokesman said.
Fighting between Hezbollah militants in Lebanon and Israeli forces in the north has intensified in recent weeks, sparking fears that the month-long conflict in Gaza will spread.
2" commander who was involved in the 1983 Beirut bombings of a Marine barracks bombing that killed 241 U.S. military personnel.
The IDF strike served as a response to an attack that killed a dozen youths in Israel's Golan Heights, but Hezbollah continues to deny any involvement in that attack, while the IDF identified Shukr as the mastermind behind the attack.
event_breakdown: IDF (Israel Defense Forces) fires approximately 30 projectiles towards Lebannon as a response to the continued attacks by Hezbollah militants, though no casualties were reported. Target - Hezbollah militants/Lebannon.

title: Hezbollah fires 30 rockets toward Israel as threat of greater conflict in region remains high
message:
Hezbollah fired about 30 rockets from Lebanon toward northern Israel Sunday night, as tensions in the region remained high following the assassination of a top Hamas leader last month.
The series of rockets was launched after an Israeli airstrike in the southern part of Lebanon injured 12 people, according to reports.
The Iran-backed terror organization said it launched the attack in support of the Palestinian people in war-torn Gaza and in retaliation for the Israeli strike in southern Lebanon, according to CNN.
AFP via Getty ImagesIsraeli forces said there were no injuries from the more than two dozen Hezbollah rockets as some fell in open space.
The region remains fraught with anxiety following the assassination of top Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh last month in Tehran as Israel continues its military campaign in Gaza following the Oct. 7 attack.

title: Report : IDF put on high alert after preparations for Iranian attack observed
message:
The IDF has been placed on high alert after Hezbollah and Iranian forces were observed preparing for an attack against Israel, the Wall Street Journal reported.
A source told the WSJ that Israel is not certain that an attack is imminent, but is proceeding with caution in light of the preparations by Iran and Hezbollah.
They stress, however, that Israel and the U.S. do not know the exact timing of the attack."
Iran has been threatening to attack Israel since the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran nearly two weeks ago.
Hezbollah is likely to participate in the Iranian attack when it does occur or even attack first.
event_breakdown:
IDF on high alert
IDF on high alert following Hezbollah and Iranian force activity

title: US carrier strike group is rushed to the Middle East
message:
A US carrier strike group has been rushed to the Middle East as new Israeli intelligence suggests Iran will launch an attack within a matter of days.
US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered a guided missile submarine to the Middle East late Sunday, telling the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group to move quickly into the area, the Defense Department announced.
Israeli intelligence now thinks that attack could come within the next two days - before the Gaza hostage and ceasefire deal talks planned for Thursday, potentially jeopardizing negotiations.
Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant (left) has now warned Iran and Hezbollah to avoid retaliatory strikes against Israel.
The Iranian Revolutionary Guards Corps is pushing for a more severe and broader response than Iran's April 13 attack on Israel.
event_breakdown: US carrier rush to avoid upcoming Iran response. American forces are positioning within the region as a deterrent measure, following intel that Iran is planning a strike against Israel. Israeli officials are warning against an escalation between the two countries that could disrupt the hostage exchanges currently in the negotiation phase.

title: US Scrambles Submarines And Aircrafts To Middle East Amid Rising Unrest
message:
U.S. Defense Secretary, Lloyd Austin, has ordered an expedited deployment of a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East, in light of escalating regional tensions.
What Happened: Austin has directed a guided missile submarine and the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group to hasten their journey to the Middle East, AP News reported on Monday.
Austin has communicated with Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, reiterating America’s commitment to Israel’s defense and highlighting the strengthening of U.S. military capabilities in the Middle East.
The specific implications of Austin’s latest directive and the timeline for Lincoln’s arrival in the Middle East are yet to be clarified.
The Middle East has been experiencing heightened tensions, with significant diplomatic efforts underway to prevent a broader regional conflict.
event_breakdown: U.S. Defense Secretary, Lloyd Austin, has ordered an expedited deployment of a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East, in light of escalating regional tensions.

title: Israeli , US Defence Chiefs discuss Iran threat as nuclear sub , strike force deployed to region
message:
Browse > Home News / Israeli, US Defence Chiefs discuss Iran threat as nuclear sub, strike force deployed to region – J-WireIsraeli, US Defence Chiefs discuss Iran threat as nuclear sub, strike force deployed to regionRead on for articleThe Pentagon took the unusual step of publicizing the deployment of a nuclear-powered submarine to the region on Monday.
The Pentagon said US Secretary of Defence Lloyd Austin ordered the deployment of the USS Georgia, a guided missile submarine, after discussions with his Israeli counterpart, Yoav Gallant.
Gallant detailed the Israeli military’s readiness and capabilities as threats from Iran and its Shi’ite proxies remain high.
Austin also ordered the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier strike force to accelerate its deployment to the region, where it will augment the USS Theodore Roosevelt strike force.
Hezbollah has vowed revenge for a separate Israeli airstrike in Beirut which killed Fuad Shukr.

title: US Accelerates Carrier Group Deployment to Middle East
message:
U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has escalated military readiness by deploying a guided missile submarine to the Middle East and expediting the movement of the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group to the region, according to a recent announcement from the Defense Department.
The Pentagon has heightened its surveillance for potential retaliatory strikes by Iran and Hezbollah following these assassinations.
In a statement, Pentagon Press Secretary Maj. Gen. Pat Ryder highlighted that Secretary Austin, in a conversation with Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, reaffirmed America’s dedication to defending Israel and enhancing U.S. military capabilities in the Middle East due to increasing regional tensions.
Although it’s unclear how soon the Lincoln and the USS Georgia guided missile submarine will reach their destinations, their deployment underscores the U.S. commitment to its strategic interests in the region.
Additionally, Austin and Gallant discussed the ongoing military operations in Gaza, emphasizing the need to minimize civilian casualties.

2. Deployment of the USS Georgia guided missile submarine to the Middle East and expedited movement of USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group to the region.
3. Reaffirmation of U.S. dedication to defending Israel and enhanced military capabilities in the Middle East by Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin.

title: Israel escalates airstrikes in Gaza as ceasefire talks stall
message:
A Palestinian man inspects the site of an Israeli strike on a house, amid Israel-Hamas conflict, in Gaza City August 12, 2024.
Palestinian medics said Israeli military strikes on Khan Younis on Monday killed at least 18 people and wounded several.
Later an Israeli airstrike killed five people in the Zeitoun suburb of Gaza City, and two others were killed in Rafah, near the border with Egypt, medics said.
The Israeli military on Monday released an updated document with names and other details of 31 fighters it said were killed in Saturday's strike.
Gaza health officials say most of the conflict's fatalities have been civilians but Israel says at least a third were fighters.

title: Starmer warns Iran not to attack Israel amid joint call for ceasefire
message:
Sir Keir Starmer has warned the Iranian president not to attack Israel in his first call with the Islamic Republic’s new leader.
The prime minister spoke to Masoud Pezeshkian on Monday as western leaders engaged in urgent diplomacy to avoid a drone and missile barrage that could send the Middle East to the brink of regional war.
Israel is braced for a significant attack following the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, the leader of Hamas, in Tehran last month.
Haniyeh was attending the funeral of Ebrahim Raisi, the former president of Iran, when he was killed by an explosion that has been attributed to Israel.
Pezeshkian, 69, a reformist who succeeded against the more hardline candidate, Saeed Jalili, replaced Raisi after he died in a helicopter

title: Hezbollah says two fighters killed in Israeli strike
message:
Lebanon's Hezbollah movement said an Israeli airstrike on Sunday killed two fighters from the Iran-backed group, with the health ministry reporting another death from an attack days ago.
An "Israeli strike that targeted the village of Taybeh today left two dead," the Lebanese health ministry said in a statement.
Hezbollah confirmed they were group fighters, killed in Taybeh near the border with Israel.
The Israeli military said it had "struck throughout the day several Hezbollah military structures in the area of Adaisseh", which is located next to Taybeh.
According to the health ministry, at least one Lebanese and 11 Syrians were injured, two seriously, in an Israeli strike on Maaroub, near Derdghaiya.

Event 1: Two Hezbollah fighters were killed in an Israeli airstrike on Sunday in Taybeh near the border with Israel. Israeli military said it had struck Hezbollah military structures in the area of Adaisseh.
Event 2: Two people were killed, and least one Lebanese and 11 Syrians were injured, two seriously, in an Israeli strike on Maaroub, near Derdghaiya.

title: U . S . Sending Submarine To Middle East , Accelerates Arrival Of Strike Group
message:
The United States is deploying a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East as tensions escalate in the region.
The move comes as Israel prepares for potential retaliatory attacks from Iran and its proxies following the assassinations of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah.
The Pentagon confirmed that Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered the dispatch of the USS Georgia guided missile submarine and the USS Abraham Lincoln Carrier Strike Group, equipped with F-35C fighter jets, to the region.
The decision to publicly announce the deployment of a submarine is a rare step, indicating the seriousness of the situation.
Both Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the killing, and while Israel has remained quiet on the matter, it is widely believed to have carried out the assassination.

Text:
The United States is deploying a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East as tensions escalate in the region following recent high-profile assassinations.

Date: 2023-06-01

Region: Mideast

title: U . S . Sending Submarine To Middle East , Accelerates Arrival Of Strike Group
message:
The United States is deploying a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East as tensions escalate in the region.
The move comes as Israel prepares for potential retaliatory attacks from Iran and its proxies following the assassinations of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah.
The Pentagon confirmed that Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered the dispatch of the USS Georgia guided missile submarine and the USS Abraham Lincoln Carrier Strike Group, equipped with F-35C fighter jets, to the region.
The decision to publicly announce the deployment of a submarine is a rare step, indicating the seriousness of the situation.
Both Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the killing, and while Israel has remained quiet on the matter, it is widely believed to have carried out the assassination.
event_breakdown: Tensions in the Middle East escalate as the United States deploys a guided missile submarine and an aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East amid rising tensions in the region. This comes after a series of assassinations of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah.

event_breakdown:
Title: Deployment of USS Georgia and USS Abraham Lincoln to Middle East Amid Escalating Tensions

Location: Strait of Hormuz, Persian Gulf

On February 3rd, 2021, the Pentagon announced that the Secretary of Defense, Lloyd Austin, has ordered the deployment of the USS Georgia guided missile submarine and the USS Abraham Lincoln Aircraft Carrier Strike Group to the Middle East. The USS Georgia accompanied by guided-missile cruisers, the destroyer USS O’Conner, and guided-missile destroyer USS Sampson will be deployed to the Persian Gulf through the Strait of Hormuz.

This action is in response to mounting tensions after a military intelligence gathering exercise conducted by Israel in Jerusalem, which resulted in the deaths of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah. After the operation, Tehran vowed to avenge Hezbollah commander, Iranian General Muhammad Ali Allahdadi, and Hamas commander Mohammad Edoujda, in coordination with its supporters and allies in the region. The increased US naval presence near the Persian Gulf is likely targeted towards Iran and its proxies. Additionally, the US also dispatched the USS Nimitz in January and USS Eisenhower last month to the area.

title: At Least 100 Killed , Dozens Injured in Israeli Strike on Gaza City School
message:
At Least 100 Killed, Dozens Injured in Israeli Strike on Gaza City School - ReportsSputnik News20240810MOSCOW (Sputnik) - At least 100 people were killed and dozens others wounded in Israel's bombing of a school in Gaza City, Press TV reported on Telegram.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) earlier on Saturday said it carried out an airstrike on a school in Gaza City, claiming it housed fighters from the Palestinian movement Hamas.
On October 7, 2023, Israel was subjected to an unprecedented rocket attack from the Gaza Strip.
In retaliation, the IDF launched Operation Iron Swords in the Gaza Strip.
The death toll from Israeli strikes on the Gaza Strip since October 7 has exceeded 39,700, according to the enclave's health ministry.

title: US publicly announces submarine move to Middle East amid Israel - Iran tensions
message:
US publicly announces submarine move to Middle East amid Israel-Iran tensionsWorld World US publicly announces submarine move to Middle East amid Israel-Iran tensionsThe Pentagon said Austin had ordered the Abraham Lincoln strike group to accelerate to the regionFollow on Published On: Mon, 12 Aug 2024 10:46:20 PKTWASHINGTON (Reuters) – US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has ordered the deployment of a guided missile submarine to the Middle East, the Pentagon said on Sunday, as the region braces for possible attacks by Iran and its allies after the killing of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah.
In a statement after Austin spoke with his Israeli counterpart, the Pentagon said Austin had ordered the Abraham Lincoln strike group to accelerate its deployment to the region.
The US military had already said it will deploy additional fighter jets and Navy warships to the Middle East as Washington seeks to bolster Israeli defenses.
Iran has said the US bears responsibility in the assassination of Haniyeh because of its support for Israel.
Reuters reported several US and coalition personnel were wounded in a drone attack on Friday in Syria, in the second major attack in recent days against US forces amid soaring tensions in the Middle East.

message:
Western powers have issued a joint statement Monday warning Iran and its allies to "refrain from attacks that would further escalate regional tensions" in the Middle East as they appear to soon be heading toward a breaking point.
"We are deeply concerned by the heightened tensions in the region, and united in our commitment to de-escalation and regional stability.
"No country or nation stands to gain from a further escalation in the Middle East."
On Monday, the Lebanon-based terrorist group Hezbollah launched 30 rockets into northern Israel, although no casualties were reported, according to the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF).
The tensions in the Middle East are also spilling over stateside.

title: US orders carrier group to hasten ME arrival
message:
US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered an aircraft carrier group to hasten its arrival in the Middle East, the Pentagon said Sunday, as mounting tensions raise fears of a region-wide war.
It is a show of support for key US ally Israel after Iran and the Lebanese Hezbollah group vowed to avenge last month's killings of Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh and Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr.
Austin ordered the aircraft carrier strike group led by the USS Abraham Lincoln, and equipped with F-35 fighters, to "accelerate its transit" to the region, said Pentagon spokesman Major General Pat Ryder.
The United States announced last week that it was deploying the strike group, as well as additional ballistic missile defense-capable cruisers and destroyers, and a fighter squadron.

title: Israel Used US - Supplied Bomb in Massacre of 93 Palestinians at Prayer in School
message:
Israeli forces used at least one GBU-39, a 250-pound bomb made by Boeing, in the strike against a school-turned-shelter.
Israeli forces used at least one U.S.-provided bomb in its massacre in a school-turned-shelter that killed nearly 100 Palestinians as they were conducting morning prayers on Saturday, a report finds.
CNN reports that Israel used a GBU-39 small diameter bomb in the strike, citing an analysis by former U.S. army explosive ordnance disposal technician Trevor Ball who was shown footage of fragments of the bomb found at the site.
According to military guides, 250-pound bombs have a 10 percent chance of killing or incapacitating anyone within a 115-foot radius of the impact.
Gaza officials have said that the al-Tabin school, in Gaza City, was sheltering 6,000 forcibly displaced Palestinians when Israel bombed it.

title: USS Abraham Lincoln ordered to  accelerate  to Middle East
message:
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered the USS Abraham Lincoln and its carrier strike group to speed up its transit to the Middle East, as the United States prepares for a possible retaliatory strike by Iran against Israel following an assassination inside Tehran.
The USS Abraham Lincoln Carrier Strike Group will join the USS Theodore Roosevelt Strike Group, which was deployed to the Middle East earlier this summer to replace the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower and its support ships.
It’s unclear how quickly the USS Abraham Lincoln will be able to reach the Middle East.
It recently was in the Pacific Ocean this past week, including carrying out a joint drill with the Italian Navy’s Cavour Carrier Strike Group.
This past week approximately a dozen U.S. Air Force F-22 fighter jets arrived in the Middle East to bolster American forces there.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: U.S. defense secretary orders the USS Abraham Lincoln and its carrier strike group to speed up transit to Middle East after the assassination of Iran's top nuclear scientist on the 27th of November, amid preparations in the region for a retaliatory attack by Iran against Israel.
Event 2: A dozen F-22 fighter jets arrived in the Middle East around 27th of November to reinforce American forces in the region due to the recent assassination of Iran's top nuclear scientist.

Lee Sung Joon, spokesperson of South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff, said about 19,000 South Korean troops will participate in the drills, which he described as an “essential element for maintaining a strong defence posture to protect the Republic of Korea”, using South Korea’s formal name.
In response, South Korea, the United States and Japan have been expanding their combined military exercises and sharpening their nuclear deterrence strategies built around US strategic assets.
South Korea’s military said on Monday that the North launched about 240 balloons, but only 10 were known to have landed in the South, all in areas north of the capital Seoul.
It was the first time North Korea flew balloons towards the South since July 24, when rubbish carried by at least one of them fell on the South Korean presidential compound, raising worries about the vulnerability of key South Korean facilities.
Also on Monday, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol nominated presidential security chief Kim Yong-hyun, one of his closest confidants, as defence minister.
event_breakdown:
North Korea fires missiles toward East Sea
North Korea fired two suspected short-range ballistic missiles toward the East Sea on Wednesday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) said.
The two missiles were launched from central inland areas in an eastward direction from the Sunan Airfield in Pyongyang, according to the JCS.
The military said that the flight distance is estimated to be around 800 kilometers and at a lofted angle. Japan's Defense Ministry also confirmed the launch, saying it had spotted two ballistic missiles launched from North Korea.
The launch came just two days after North Korea carried out a railway-borne missile test, which marked the regime's first missile launch in about three months. That missile test involved the North launching a pair of KN-23 missiles from a train transporter.
On the same day as that missile launch, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said that it had detected the North firing multiple short-range anti-ship cruise missiles off its east coast.

title: South Korea and US will start summer military drills next week to counter North Korean threats
message:
(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea and the United States will begin their annual joint military exercises next week with a focus on improving their combined capabilities to deter and defend against growing North Korean nuclear threats, the allies said Monday.
In addition to its military exercises with the United States, the South Korean military will support the country’s civil defense and evacuation drills on Aug. 19-22, which will include programs based on North Korean nuclear attack scenarios, Lee said.
During last year’s Ulchi Freedom Shield exercises, North Korea conducted ballistic missile tests that it described as simulating “scorched earth” nuclear strikes on South Korean targets.
It was the first time North Korea flew balloons toward the South since July 24, when trash carried by at least one of them fell on the South Korean presidential compound, raising worries about the vulnerability of key South Korean facilities.
Also on Monday, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol nominated presidential security chief Kim Yong-hyun, one of his closest confidants, as defense minister.
event_breakdown:
North Korea fires ballistic missile - it flew approximately 800 kilometers (500 miles) at a maximum altitude of 2.5 kilometers (1.5 miles), South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said Monday. It landed inside Japan's exclusive economic zone in the Sea of Japan.
South Korean military and the U.S. stages annual drills - the exercise was billed as of a defensive command post exercise and computer-simulated war game designed to certify the allies' ability to operate together to defend South Korea.

title: Battle of Kursk | Eastern Front , German Offensive , Soviet Counterattack
message:
Battle of Kursk, (July 5–August 23, 1943), unsuccessful German assault on the Soviet salient around the city of Kursk, in western Russia, during World War II.
The salient was a bulge in the Soviet lines that stretched 150 miles (240 km) from north to south and protruded 100 miles (160 km) westward into the German lines.
But the Soviets had surmised the German attack beforehand and had withdrawn their main forces from the obviously threatened positions within the salient.
The Battle of Kursk was the largest tank battle in history, involving some 6,000 tanks, 2,000,000 troops, and 4,000 aircraft.
It marked the decisive end of the German offensive capability on the Eastern Front and cleared the way for the great Soviet offensives of 1944–45.
event_breakdown: Battle of Kursk, (July 5–August 23, 1943), unsuccessful German assault on the Soviet salient around the city of Kursk, in western Russia, during World War II. The salient was a bulge in the Soviet lines that stretched some 150 miles from north to south and protruded some 100 miles west off the German lines. The Soviets misconstrued the German onslaught beforehand and had withdrawn their main forces from the plainly threatened positions within the salient. The Battle of Kursk was the biggest tank conflict in historical times, involving about 6,000 tanks, 2,000,000 troops, and 4,000 aircraft. It marked the decisive end of the German offensive capability on the Eastern Front and took the limelight for the Soviet Union's great offensives in 1944–1945.

title: Zionist bases hit in Hezbollah combined attacks
message:
Zionist bases hit in Hezbollah combined attacksIRNA - Islamic Republic News AgencyAug 11, 2024Tehran, IRNA -- Lebanese Hezbollah resistance movement says it has launched a series of drone, rocket and missile attacks on Zionist bases in the northern parts of the Israeli-occupied Palestinian territories.
In a rocket attack on Sunday, Hezbollah fighters targeted the surroundings of a military base where Zionist soldiers were gathering.
It also announced two separate attacks on Al Marj and Ruwaisat Al-Alam military bases.
Meanwhile, Lebanese media reported the death of two people after their motorbike was hit by an Israeli drone strike in Taybeh village in south of the country.
Hezbollah and the Israeli army have been trading fire across Lebanon's southern border since October 8, a day after the regime launched its devastating war on Gaza.

title: Gallant Warns of  Significant Damage  if Iran , Hezbollah Provoke Israel
message:
Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has issued a stern warning of unprecedented retaliation should Iran and Hezbollah initiate attacks on Israel.
During a visit to a military base on Sunday, Gallant emphasized the severity of the threats from Iran and Hezbollah, which he described as unprecedented, underlining the existential battle Israel faces.
Gallant expressed hope that Iran and Hezbollah would reconsider their actions to avoid pushing Israel to respond with significant force, potentially escalating to war on multiple fronts.
The leaders of France, Germany, and Britain have urged Iran and its allies to avoid any retaliatory attacks that could worsen regional tensions.
U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, after speaking with Gallant, reaffirmed America’s defense commitment to Israel and discussed the increased U.S. military presence in the region.

title: How Indian North East unsung heroes and rebellions defied British colonial rule
message:

location: Based on the context provided, the most specific location for the events described in the text would be "North East India
event_breakdown:
North East India is currently experiencing a period of unrest due to renewed violence between tribal separatists and the Indian government. Militant groups are fighting for independence or greater autonomy in the region, and the conflict has resulted in numerous deaths and injuries. The states of Manipur, Assam, Nagaland, and Tripura are all affected by the unrest, and the central government is struggling to maintain control.

In the last week, there have been several incidents of violence in the region. In Manipur, a clash between Indian forces and separatist fighters left three people dead, including a small child. In Assam, a bomb exploded in a crowded market, killing six people and injuring dozens more. And in Nagaland, a pro-government militia killed six people in an attack on a village.

The Indian government has been attempting to crack down on the separatist groups, but with limited success. Many locals resent the Indian presence in the region and support the rebels, who are often seen as fighting for the rights of indigenous tribes. The conflict is likely to continue for the foreseeable future, and there is little sign of a peaceful resolution.

title: 106th Rescue Wing 1st HH - 60W Jolly Green II Takes Flight
message:
The 106th Plans To Complete Aircrew Training On The New Model By MarchThe 106th Rescue Wing’s first HH-60W Jolly Green II search and rescue helicopter made its inaugural flight from Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base Aug. 4.
The new version of the HH-60 rescue helicopter takes its “Jolly Green II” nickname from the Sikorsky HH-3 helicopter’s search and rescue wings used from the 1960s until 1991.
The 106th Rescue Wing, based at Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base in Westhampton Beach, New York, operates and maintains the HC-130J Combat King II search and rescue aircraft and the HH-60G Pave Hawk rescue helicopter.
The wing is home to a special warfare squadron with pararescuemen and combat rescue officers specializing in rescue and recovery and deploys for domestic and overseas operations.
(ANN Salutes Senior Airman Sarah McKernan, 106th Rescue Wing, for the story).
event_breakdown: 106th Rescue Wing makes the Jolly Green II SAR helicopter's inaugural flight at Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base in Westhampton Beach, New York.

title: Suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels targets ship in southern Red Sea , officials say
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Suspected attacks by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted shipping in the Red Sea on Tuesday, officials said, the latest in their campaign of assaults over the Israel-Hamas war.
Though the Houthis didn’t immediately claim the attack, it sometimes can take hours or even days to acknowledge their assaults.
The rebels maintain that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or the U.K. as part of a campaign they say seeks to force an end to the war.
After the strikes, the Houthis paused their attacks until Aug. 3, when they hit a Liberian-flagged container ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden.
A Liberian-flagged oil tanker came under a particularly intense series of attacks beginning Aug. 8 likely carried out by the rebels.

title: UN chief condemns continued loss of life following deadly Israeli strike on Gaza school
message:
UN chief condemns continued loss of life following deadly Israeli strike on Gaza schoolXinhua) 08:35, August 13, 2024People mourn victims killed in an Israeli airstrike at a school serving as shelters for displaced people in Al-Daraj neighborhood in Gaza City, Aug. 10, 2024.
UNITED NATIONS, Aug. 12 (Xinhua) -- UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Monday condemned the continued loss of life in Gaza, following a devastating strike by Israel on the Al-Taba'een school in Gaza City on Saturday killing over 100 Palestinians.
"The secretary-general condemns the continued loss of life in Gaza, including women and children, as we witness yet another devastating strike by Israel on the Al-Taba'een school in Gaza City, sheltering hundreds of displaced Palestinian families, with scores of fatalities, amidst continued horror, displacement, and suffering in Gaza," said Farhan Haq, the deputy spokesperson for the UN secretary-general.
Guterres was dismayed to see that the provisions of UN Security Council resolution 2735 remain unimplemented, Haq said.
More than 100 Palestinians were killed and dozens of others were injured in an Israeli bombing of the Al-Taba'een school in central Gaza City early Saturday, Palestinian medical and security sources said.
event_breakdown: Event: 100 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli bombing of the Al-Taba'een school in central Gaza City on Saturday. The attack left dozens of others injured.

title: Today in military history : Armistice ends the Spanish - American War
message:
On Aug. 12, 1898, the Spanish-American War ended in armistice.
The resulting war was focused on Cuba, but the growing American military contested Spain across its empire, resulting in combat from the Atlantic to Pacific.
American sympathy for Cuba grew and U.S. intervention became inevitable after the sinking of the USS Maine in Havana harbor.

title: 106th Rescue Wing 1st HH - 60W Jolly Green II Takes Flight
message:
The 106th Plans To Complete Aircrew Training On The New Model By MarchThe 106th Rescue Wing’s first HH-60W Jolly Green II search and rescue helicopter made its inaugural flight from Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base Aug. 4.
The new version of the HH-60 rescue helicopter takes its “Jolly Green II” nickname from the Sikorsky HH-3 helicopter’s search and rescue wings used from the 1960s until 1991.
The 106th Rescue Wing, based at Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base in Westhampton Beach, New York, operates and maintains the HC-130J Combat King II search and rescue aircraft and the HH-60G Pave Hawk rescue helicopter.
The wing is home to a special warfare squadron with pararescuemen and combat rescue officers specializing in rescue and recovery and deploys for domestic and overseas operations.
(ANN Salutes Senior Airman Sarah McKernan, 106th Rescue Wing, for the story).
location: Francis S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base

title: Top Ukrainian commander says his forces now control almost 390 square miles of Russia Kursk region
message:
KYIV, Ukraine — Ukraine's top military commander said Monday his forces control 386 square miles of Russia's neighboring Kursk region, the first time a Ukrainian military official publicly commented on the gains of the lightning incursion that has embarrassed the Kremlin.
Russian forces are still scrambling to respond to the surprise Ukrainian attack after almost a week of fierce fighting.
Zelenskyy confirmed for the first time that the Ukrainian military is inside the Kursk region.
Alexei Smirnov reported to Putin that Ukrainian forces pushed 7.5 miles into the Kursk region across a 25-mile front and control 28 Russian settlements.
The governor of the Belgorod region adjacent to Kursk also announced the evacuation of people from a district near the Ukrainian border.
event_breakdown: ['Ukraine's military vowed to press deeper into Kursk; Ukraine claimed total control of territory along western axis of Russian advance, claiming that Russia still had not responded to its deployment in the border.']

title: Ship targeted multiple times in Red Sea
message:
Maritime authorities were investigating multiple attacks on a ship reported in Red Sea overnight in an area where Iran-aligned Houthis have targeted global shipping.
The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations received a report of an explosion 174 kilometers northwest of Yemen’s Hodeidah early Tuesday morning.
The report came hours after two other blasts were reported by the captain of the same ship 117 kilometers southwest of Hodeidah, according to the private security firm Ambrey.
In the earlier incidents, an explosive was detonated near the ship, and crew members saw a small vessel “acting suspiciously,” coming close to the ship and flashing a light.
The Houthis began their campaign to disrupt shipping in the Red Sea to show solidarity with Palestinians in the war between Israel and Hamas.

One male hostage was killed, while two female hostages sustained gunshot wounds and are feared to be in critical condition.
In the days following Hamas' ruthless October 7 attacks, there were fears that Israeli hostages would face torture and executions - threats made by the same Hamas spokesperson that yesterday declared one of the hostages had been shot dead.

title: Iran dismisses calls from West to  stand down  retaliatory attack threats on Israel
message:
IRAN HAS DISMISSED calls by Western allies to “stand down” its threats of a retaliatory attack on Israel, claiming it shows “lack political logic and contradict principles of international law”.
The United States and other European allies said Iran must “stand down” its threats that it will launch a retaliatory attack on Israel following the assassination of the political leader of Hamas Ismail Haniyeh last month.
In a joint statement from the United States, United Kingdom, France, Germany, and Italy, the allies also expressed their full support for the de-escalation of violence in the Middle East and called for a ceasefire in Gaza.
The killings have stoked fears in Israel that Iran will issue a retaliatory attack for the assassination of Haniyeh, which was carried out in their territory, and Israeli citizens have been warned that a missile strike could be imminent.
Israel has accepted the latest invitation from the United States, Qatar and Egypt to send negotiators.

title: UN Chief Condemns Continued Loss Of Life Following Deadly Israeli Strike On Gaza School
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) UNITED NATIONS, Aug 13 (NNN-XINHUA) – UN Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres, yesterday, condemned the continued loss of life in Gaza, following a devastating strike by Israel on the Al-Taba'een school in Gaza City on Saturday, killing over 100 Palestinians.
“The secretary-general condemns the continued loss of life in Gaza, including women and children, as we witness yet another devastating strike by Israel on the Al-Taba'een school in Gaza City, sheltering hundreds of displaced Palestinian families, with scores of fatalities, amidst continued horror, displacement, and suffering in Gaza,” said Farhan Haq, the deputy spokesperson for the UN secretary-general.

Guterres also underlined that, international humanitarian law, including the principles of distinction, proportionality, and precautions in attack, must be upheld at all times, said Haq.

title: Robot  Dogs of War Deployed in Ukraine
message:
“Cry ‘Havoc!’ And let slip the dogs of war” probably wasn’t actually uttered by Roman General Mark Antony.
Enter the Robot Dogs of WarIn June 2022, the U.S. Army announced it would provide Kyiv with a pair of robotic dogs that could aid in clearing minefields and in the disposal of other ordnance.
While robotic dogs have already been used as guards to patrol the perimeter of a military base, the Ukrainian robotic dogs have been employed as scouts near villages on the frontlines around Toretsk, near the destroyed city of Bakhmut.
In June, China showcased an armed robot dog that also seemed similar in design to the Unitree Go2.
The difference from the robot dogs in Ukraine was the presence of a QBZ-95 (Type 95) assault rifle mounted to the top.
event_breakdown:
Unitree Go1
Unitree Go1 is a robot dog developed by Unitree Robotics. It was unveiled in 2018 and adopted by China's People's Liberation Army for scouting and surveillance missions.

title: IRGC tells US Navy : We can reach you at  closest point  in international waters
message:
IRGC tells US Navy: We can reach you at 'closest point' in international watersIran Press TVMonday, 12 August 2024 9:58 AMThe Islamic Revolution Guards Corps Navy is not just a coastal force but is capable of having a presence in international waters, a commander of the fifth Martyr Lieutenant General Haj Qassem Soleimani fleet of the IRGC Navy says.
"After the United States imposed sanctions on the IRGC Navy, we had to show that the IRGC Navy is not just a coastal force and is capable of supplying various types of heavy vessels, enabling it to have a presence in international waters," Colonel Soleimani said on Monday.
During its mission, he noted, the Shahid Mahdavi warship passed through important and strategic straits of the world, including the Strait of Malaga.
The 2,100-tonne Shahid Mahdavi, a multipurpose vessel designed for long-range operations, is 240 meters in length and 27 meters in width.
The Shahid Mahdavi is capable of carrying various types of attack helicopters, combat drones as well as fast attack craft.

title: Escalating Maritime Conflict in the Red Sea : Yemen Houthi Rebels Target Ships
message:
A ship in the Red Sea was attacked on Tuesday in a suspected operation by Yemen's Houthi rebels, marking the third such incident amidst the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict, according to officials.
This series of assaults has disrupted the USD 1 trillion annual flow of goods along a vital maritime route connecting Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.
The Houthi attacks have led to the most severe combat for the US Navy since World War II.
An explosive detonated near the ship 115 kilometers south of Hodeida, followed by a second blast from a suspicious vessel, as reported by the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center.
Subsequent explosions occurred later the same day off the same ship, 180 kilometers northwest of Hodeida, according to the private security firm Ambrey.
event_breakdown: Target event: A ship in the Red Sea was attacked on Tuesday in a suspected operation by Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title: NATO exercise highlights international operability
message:
NATO exercise highlights international operabilityBy Spc.
NATO countries conducted the exercise to familiarize themselves with each other's land fighting tactics and capabilities, ensuring they can work together and communicate effectively.
As collaboration continued, U.S. Army CH-47 Chinooks took to the sky as they transported Canadian troops into the field.
Task Force Lobos Soldiers of 2nd General Support Aviation Battalion, 227th Aviation Regiment, 1st Air Cavalry Brigade, 1st Cavalry Division conducted air mobility operations with Canadian Army troops.
The collaboration gave the Canadian troops a realistic training experience and afforded Lobos crews the opportunity to hone their skills while gaining valuable NATO interoperability exposure from the training event.

title: Red Sea ship attacked three times in suspected Houthi rebel assault
message:
A ship in the Red Sea came under attack at least three times Tuesday in an assault that included the use of a bomb-carrying drone boat, likely the latest in a campaign by Yemen's Houthi rebels over the Israel-Hamas war, officials said.
The ship was first attacked as an explosive was detonated near it, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The private security firm Ambrey similarly reported the attacks, saying the ship saw "two 'close-proximity' explosions."
Other missiles and drones have been either intercepted by a U.S.-led coalition in the Red Sea or failed to reach their targets.
Additional F-22 fighter jets have flown into the region, while the USS Wasp, a large amphibious assault ship carrying F-35 fighter jets, is in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Virginia school district makes U - turn on Confederate names
message:
Briana Brown and A.D. Carter are starting their senior year of high school in Shenandoah County on Tuesday.
But their pride ends when it comes to the school’s name - Stonewall Jackson High School, named after a prominent Confederate general in America’s Civil War.
But just four years later, the school board reversed its decision, changing back to the original name honouring the Confederate general.
Among the common school names targeted are Jackson, founding father Thomas Jefferson, who owned slaves, and Confederate General Robert E. Lee.
When the school board voted 5-1 to remove the name of Stonewall Jackson from the high school, in 2020, it stirred up local debate.

message:
CNN —It is another coin-flip in a conflict punctuated with at least annual reminders of how frail Vladimir Putin’s Russia truly is.
It is purposefully unclear exactly where Ukraine’s forces are.

title: Top Ukrainian commander says his forces now control almost 390 square miles of Russia Kursk region - Boston News , Weather , Sports
message:
KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s top military commander says his forces now control 1,000 square kilometers (386 square miles) of Russia’s neighboring Kursk region, the first time a Ukrainian military official has publicly commented on the gains of the lightning incursion that has embarrassed the Kremlin.
Russian forces are still scrambling to respond to the surprise Ukrainian attack after almost a week of fierce fighting.
Zelenskyy confirmed for the first time that the Ukrainian military is inside the Kursk region.
Alexei Smirnov reported to Putin that Ukrainian forces had pushed 12 kilometers (7.5 miles) into the Kursk region across a 40-kilometer (25-mile) front and currently control 28 Russian settlements.
The ministry said Russian forces also blocked an attempt by Ukrainian mobile groups to forge deep into Russian territory near Kauchuk.

message:
The moves came amid mounting fears that Iran might soon respond to the assassination of Hamas’ political leader, Ismail Haniyeh, who was killed in Tehran last month after attending the inauguration ceremony for Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian.
Both Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the killing, and while Israel has remained quiet on the matter it is widely believed to have carried out the assassination.
As Israel braces for retaliatory attacks from Iran and its proxies after the assassination of senior members of Hamas and Hezbollah, Israel Defense Forces spokesman Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari said in a statement Monday: “We’re following Hezbollah and Iran and ready.
The joint statement read: “They will bear responsibility for actions that jeopardize this opportunity for peace and stability.
No country or nation stands to gain from a further escalation in the Middle East.”Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei vowed “severe punishment” for the assassination, but it remains unclear exactly how Iran plans to retaliate.

title: Devastated By Russian Strike , Kyiv Largest Children Hospital Starts Long Road to Reconstruction
message:
KYIV — Before it was ripped apart by a Russian missile strike last month, the Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital treated about 700 patients daily.
One month after the devastating strike that killed at least 42 people, including five children, global headlines have moved on.
Hospital director Volodymyr Zhovnir estimates the damages of the July 8 strike, which damaged six of Okhmatdyt’s buildings, could amount to several hundred million dollars.
Over 300 people, including staff and patients, sustained injuries widely ranging in severity.
Several of the hospital buildings are now mere shells of their former state.
event_breakdown: In Ukraine, a Russian missile strike killed more than 40 people and destroyed a hospital building in Kyiv. The hospital, Okhmatdyt Children's Hospital, was rebuilt after the attack, but it has since been destroyed again. The attack wounded more than 300 people and damaged six buildings, including the hospital.

message:

That effort has focused on trying to inject new life into cease-fire talks involving the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas.

title: Man charged with attempted murder in stabbing of 11 - year - old girl in a London tourism hot spot
message:
Man charged with attempted murder in stabbing of 11-year-old girl in a London tourism hot spotA Police officer stands at the scene in Leicester Square, as a man was arrested with the accusation of stabbing an 11-year-old girl and 34-year-old woman, in London, Monday Aug. 12, 2024.
(James Manning/PA via AP)LONDON (AP) — A man accused of stabbing an 11-year-old girl in London’s bustling theater district was charged Tuesday with attempted murder.
Ioan Pintaru put the girl in a headlock and stabbed her eight times, seriously wounding her, prosecutors said.
The girl was hospitalized and required plastic surgery for wounds to her face, shoulder, wrist and neck area, prosecutor David Burns said.
The attack happened around 11:30 a.m. on Monady in Leicester Square, a tourism hot spot, outside a shop selling tea.

title: France set to remember African role in WWII Provence landings
message:
Goumiers, auxiliary soldiers supplied to the French army by Algerian or Moroccan tribes, march in Paris on July 14, 1945.
On August 15, 1944, some 100,000 American, British and Canadian troops landed on the beaches of the Var region on the French Riviera.
They were followed by 250,000 Free French soldiers, recruited mostly from French overseas colonies in Africa with the aim of recapturing key port cities Marseille and Toulon from the German occupiers.
It took decades for post-war France to highlight the crucial role of non-white soldiers in the fighting.
Macron's 2019 call to name streets in France after African combatants has largely gone unheeded, although many French towns remember the African contributions in their own way, including on monuments and memorial sites.

title: Russia Kursk region has had 386 miles seized by Ukraine – NBC Chicago
message:
Ukraine's top military commander says his forces now control 1,000 square kilometers (386 square miles) of Russia's neighboring Kursk region, the first time a Ukrainian military official has publicly commented on the gains of the lightning incursion that has embarrassed the Kremlin.
Russian forces are still scrambling to respond to the surprise Ukrainian attack after almost a week of fierce fighting.
Zelenskyy confirmed for the first time that the Ukrainian military is inside the Kursk region.
Alexei Smirnov reported to Putin that Ukrainian forces had pushed 12 kilometers (7.5 miles) into the Kursk region across a 40-kilometer (25-mile) front and currently control 28 Russian settlements.
The ministry said Russian forces also blocked an attempt by Ukrainian mobile groups to forge deep into Russian territory near Kauchuk.
location: The main location where the main event takes place is Ukraine.
event_breakdown:
New Ukrainian incursion into Russian territory reported.
New Ukrainian incursion into Russian territory reported. Ukraine's top military commander announced that his forces have pushed into Russian territory over the past several days, taking several villages and holding some 28 Russian settlements in the Kursk region. The Russian Defense Ministry acknowledged the new incursion as Ukrainian forces advanced more than 12 kilometers and captured some 40 km2 from Russian control.

Zelenskyy confirmed for the first time that the Ukrainian military is inside the Kursk region.
Alexei Smirnov reported to Putin that Ukrainian forces had pushed 12 kilometers (7.5 miles) into the Kursk region across a 40-kilometer (25-mile) front and currently control 28 Russian settlements.
The ministry said Russian forces also blocked an attempt by Ukrainian mobile groups to forge deep into Russian territory near Kauchuk.
location: The main event takes place in the Kursk region of Russia.

Ukraine's top military commander says that his forces now control 1,000 square kilometers (386 square miles) of Russia's neighboring Kursk region. This information was provided by Zelenskyy and was confirmed by the general staff of the Ukrainian military.

title: Russia says it thwarted a Ukrainian charge to expand its incursion . Kyiv says it wont occupy land
message:
In this photo taken from video released by Russian Defense Ministry Press Service on Monday, Aug. 12, 2024, marine assault team members ride motorcycles toward Ukrainian position at an undisclosed location.
Recommended VideosMeanwhile, Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross-border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk.
He said Russia had launched more than 2,000 strikes from the Kursk region in recent months using anti-aircraft missiles, artillery, mortars, drones, 255 glide bombs and more than 100 missiles.
Ukraine's undermanned army has struggled to hold back the bigger, better-equipped Russian forces in Donetsk.
The goals of the swift advance into the Kursk region have been a closely guarded military secret.
event_breakdown:
Russia Launches Cross-Border Military Operation in Kursk Region

Russia has launched a cross-border military operation in the Kursk region to protect Russian land from Ukrainian strikes launched from the region.
